circumstances: Following an uneventful flight from Washington DC, the crew started the descent to Chapel Hill-Horace Williams when he encountered zero visibility due to fog. On approach, the twin engine airplane struck trees and crashed. All seven occupants were killed.
probable_cause:
Collision with trees on final approach due to improper IFR operation. The following contributing factors were reported: 
- Fog,
- Improperly loaded aircraft,
- Weather slightly worse than forecast, 
- Visibility down to zero, 
- Maneuvering for contact approach, 
- Loaded near aft CG limit,
- 554 lbs over max gross weight.
